text:
81yo female w/ PMH of DM II, HOCM, CHF, GIB, Afib, VP shunt and recent
   intraventricular hemorrhage. [**5-11**] found unresponsive at NH, went into
   PEA in ambulance and they were unable to intubate.
   OSH intubated and tnsp to [**Hospital1 1**]. Remains unresponsive with  arrest,
   most likely d/t hypoglycemia. +GI bleeding, no heparin, pneumo boots
   on. Pt not waking up, but  MRI without signs of ischemia and positive
   over-shunting, no surgical intervention indicated. Neuro  following
   closely. Conts on dilantin though conts EEG was neg for seizures, only
   ecephalpathic slowing. . +Bacteremia, OSH BC showed GPC in [**4-22**] bottles,
   elevated lactate, low grade fevers, raise concern for sepsis. Cont
s on
   Vanco & ceftriaxone for +UTI. Remains on vent AC in the setting of
   unresponsiveness.  Had lg amts of melana and EGD  [**5-12**]+ for lg clot
   that could not be removed. No further episodes of melena/ hematemsis
   since [**5-13**].  [**5-16**] CXR w/ L Pneumothorax: Pigtail chest tube placed [**5-16**]
   now to water seal w/ small amts serous drainage.
    [**5-17**]- [**5-18**]:  VP shunt in head tapped for small amt CSF for culture. Pt
   pan cultured. Chest tube changed to water seal.Conts to drain serous
   fluid. [**5-18**] New TLC placed in R IJ, and heparin begun to for mechanical
   MV and clot in L arm. Family meeting held [**5-19**] with son, daughter and
   son-in-law.  Family received grim report from neurologist about very
   poor prognosis and likely scenario of pt remaining in persistent
   vegetative state. They will discuss this over the weekend and meet
   again on Monday to make decisions about care. Son does not want
   tracheostomy and believes his mother would not like to live like this.
   It is unclear at present what the daughter feels and she is the proxy.
   Pt changed to C-PAP 5/14, 5 PEEP 40%, and is breathing [**1-11**].She is
   suctioned Q2-3hr for  white, occasionally blood tinged sputum. VBG was
   adequate at 7.37/45/44/27.  VAP care continues. She received lasix 20mg
   IV with excellent diuretic response.She continues to have anasarca and
   is >10literes positive LOS. She has multiple non-worsening skin lesions
   which are documented in metavision.  She spided fever to 101.2R this
   afternoon. Cultures pending. She has started on levothryroxine IV.
   [**Hospital 4560**] hospital acquired (Procedure Related, Barotrauma)
   Assessment:
   Pig-tail chest tube remains in place draining serous fluid to water
   seal. Dsg dry and in tact
   Action:
   Output monitored. CXR done which shows minimal increase in lung
   expansion. She went for chest and abdominal CT with contrast to further
   evaluate her lungs and abdomen.
   Response:
   Pt continues to sat well and appear comfortable on CPAP.
   Plan:
   Continue with pig tail chest tube per CT [**Doctor First Name **].
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Pt remains in persistent vegetative state with unreactive pupils,
   intact gag, cough and corneals. She has roving eye movements and some
   non-purposeful movements of arms and leg. She does not focus or appear
   to respond meaningfully to stimuli. She is breathing on her own and
   changed to CPAP
   Action:
   Pt reposition Q 2hr with ROM being done Q shift. Limbs are elevated as
   she is not moving.
   Response:
   Pt shows no improvement of neurologic status
   Plan:
   Continue with supportive care until family meeting [**5-22**].
   Gastrointestinal bleed, upper (Melena, GI Bleed, GIB)
   Assessment:
   Pt has no signs of active GIB. Crit is drifting down slowly. She cont;s
   to have small soft smeary black G+ stools. She does not have NG tube
   due to lg unstable clot in stomach.
   Action:
   She continue on Protonix [**Hospital1 **]. Crit is being monitor [**Hospital1 **]. L IJ triple
   lumen is being left in in case she has large GIB. She is continueing on
   heparin for mechanical valve and clot in L arm. She continues on TPN
   for nutrition.
   Response:
   Crit drifting down to 27.5 this afternoon, she was 29 [**5-18**].  no
   significant melana.
   Plan:
   Contiue with above plan. Keep skin clean with frequent stooling.
